debug.description:
Debug Whether to enable debug logs
Deprecated: Use the GATUS_LOG_LEVEL environment variable instead

metrics.description: Metrics Whether to expose metrics at /metrics

skip-invalid-config-update.description:
SkipInvalidConfigUpdate Whether to make the application ignore invalid configuration
if the configuration file is updated while the application is running

disable-monitoring-lock.description:
DisableMonitoringLock Whether to disable the monitoring lock
The monitoring lock is what prevents multiple endpoints from being processed at the same time.
Disabling this may lead to inaccurate response times

Deprecated: Use Concurrency instead TODO: REMOVE THIS IN v6.0.0

concurrency.description:
Concurrency is the maximum number of endpoints/suites that can be monitored concurrently
Defaults to DefaultConcurrency. Set to 0 for unlimited concurrency.

security.description: Security is the configuration for securing access to Gatus

alerting.description: Alerting is the configuration for alerting providers

endpoints.description: Endpoints is the list of endpoints to monitor

external-endpoints.description: ExternalEndpoints is the list of all external endpoints

suites.description: Suites is the list of suites to monitor

storage.description: Storage is the configuration for how the data is stored

web.description: Web is the web configuration for the application

ui.description: UI is the configuration for the UI

maintenance.description: Maintenance is the configuration for creating a maintenance window in which no alerts are sent

remote.description:
Remote is the configuration for remote Gatus instances
WARNING: This is in ALPHA and may change or be completely removed in the future

connectivity.description: Connectivity is the configuration for connectivity

tunneling.description: Tunneling is the configuration for SSH tunneling

announcements.description: Announcements is the list of system-wide announcements

Config.description: Config is the main configuration structure

aws-ses.description: AWSSimpleEmailService is the configuration for the aws-ses alerting provider

custom.description: Custom is the configuration for the custom alerting provider

datadog.description: Datadog is the configuration for the datadog alerting provider

discord.description: Discord is the configuration for the discord alerting provider

email.description: Email is the configuration for the email alerting provider

github.description: GitHub is the configuration for the github alerting provider

gitlab.description: GitLab is the configuration for the gitlab alerting provider

gitea.description: Gitea is the configuration for the gitea alerting provider

googlechat.description: GoogleChat is the configuration for the googlechat alerting provider

gotify.description: Gotify is the configuration for the gotify alerting provider

homeassistant.description: HomeAssistant is the configuration for the homeassistant alerting provider

ifttt.description: IFTTT is the configuration for the ifttt alerting provider

ilert.description: Ilert is the configuration for the ilert alerting provider

incident-io.description: IncidentIO is the configuration for the incident-io alerting provider

line.description: Line is the configuration for the line alerting provider

matrix.description: Matrix is the configuration for the matrix alerting provider

mattermost.description: Mattermost is the configuration for the mattermost alerting provider

messagebird.description: Messagebird is the configuration for the messagebird alerting provider

newrelic.description: NewRelic is the configuration for the newrelic alerting provider

n8n.description: N8N is the configuration for the n8n alerting provider

ntfy.description: Ntfy is the configuration for the ntfy alerting provider

opsgenie.description: Opsgenie is the configuration for the opsgenie alerting provider

pagerduty.description: PagerDuty is the configuration for the pagerduty alerting provider

plivo.description: Plivo is the configuration for the plivo alerting provider

pushover.description: Pushover is the configuration for the pushover alerting provider

rocketchat.description: RocketChat is the configuration for the rocketchat alerting provider

sendgrid.description: SendGrid is the configuration for the sendgrid alerting provider

signal.description: Signal is the configuration for the signal alerting provider

signl4.description: SIGNL4 is the configuration for the signl4 alerting provider

slack.description: Slack is the configuration for the slack alerting provider

splunk.description: Splunk is the configuration for the splunk alerting provider

squadcast.description: Squadcast is the configuration for the squadcast alerting provider

teams.description: Teams is the configuration for the teams alerting provider

teams-workflows.description: TeamsWorkflows is the configuration for the teams alerting provider using the new Workflow App Webhook Connector

telegram.description: Telegram is the configuration for the telegram alerting provider

twilio.description: Twilio is the configuration for the twilio alerting provider

vonage.description: Vonage is the configuration for the vonage alerting provider

webex.description: Webex is the configuration for the webex alerting provider

zapier.description: Zapier is the configuration for the zapier alerting provider

zulip.description: Zulip is the configuration for the zulip alerting provider

alerting_Config.description: Config is the configuration for alerting providers

proxy-url.description: ProxyURL is the URL of the proxy to use for the client

insecure.description: Insecure determines whether to skip verifying the server's certificate chain and host name

ignore-redirect.description: IgnoreRedirect determines whether to ignore redirects (true) or follow them (false, default)

dns-resolver.description:
DNSResolver override for the HTTP client
Expected format is {protocol}://{host}:{port}, e.g. tcp://8.8.8.8:53

oauth2.description:
OAuth2Config is the OAuth2 configuration used for the client.

If non-nil, the http.Client returned by getHTTPClient will automatically retrieve a token if necessary.
See configureOAuth2 for more details.

identity-aware-proxy.description: IAPConfig is the Google Cloud Identity-Aware-Proxy configuration used for the client. (e.g. audience)

network.description: Network (ip, ip4 or ip6) for the ICMP client

tunnel.description: Tunnel is the name of the SSH tunnel to use for the client

client_Config.description: Config is the configuration for clients

client_IAPConfig.description: IAPConfig is the configuration for the Google Cloud Identity-Aware-Proxy

client_OAuth2Config.description: OAuth2Config is the configuration for the OAuth2 client credentials flow

certificate-file.description: CertificateFile is the public certificate for TLS in PEM format.

private-key-file.description: PrivateKeyFile is the private key file for TLS in PEM format.

client_TLSConfig.description: TLSConfig is the configuration for mTLS configurations

username.description: Username is the name which will need to be used for a successful authentication

password-bcrypt-base64.description:
PasswordBcryptHashBase64Encoded is the base64 encoded string of the Bcrypt hash of the password to use to
authenticate using basic auth.

security_BasicConfig.description: BasicConfig is the configuration for Basic authentication

security_Config.description: Config is the security configuration for Gatus

allowed-subjects.description: e.g. ["user1@example.com"]. If empty, all subjects are allowed

security_OIDCConfig.description: OIDCConfig is the configuration for OIDC authentication

path.description:
Path is the path used by the store to achieve persistence
If blank, persistence is disabled.
Note that not all Type support persistence

type.description:
Type of store
If blank, uses the default in-memory store

caching.description:
Caching is whether to enable caching.
This is used to drastically decrease read latency by pre-emptively caching writes
as they happen, also known as the write-through caching strategy.
Does not apply if Config.Type is not TypePostgres or TypeSQLite.

maximum-number-of-results.description: MaximumNumberOfResults is the number of results each endpoint should be able to provide

maximum-number-of-events.description: MaximumNumberOfEvents is the number of events each endpoint should be able to provide

storage_Config.description: Config is the configuration for storage
